intro: Cochranea corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually hairy as well. Cochranea corymbosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
